item.title: Installing Kubernetes on Raspberry Pi
item.description: Installing kubernetes on Raspberry Pi is easy, but there are few caveats that you need to be aware of. arm64 is preferred, because 64-bit allows you to use > 4GB of RAM per process. Enable cgroups Kubernetes relies on cgroups for enforcing limits for the containers, so kernel needs to be booted with cgroups support. On Raspberry, edit /boot/firmware/cmdline.txt and add the following options: cgroup_enable=memory swapaccount=1 cgroup_memory=1 cgroup_enable=cpuset Reboot after making the changes.
